parameters: \pop[2]We all sit back in the hotel room, trying to relax.
\pop[2]This might be the last time we get to do this.
\pop[2]Thankfully, we've made it this far without any hiccups.
\pop[2]And tomorrow? Everything would come to an end.
\pop[2]\c[14]Hopefully\c[0] in our favor, but at this point, I have no idea.
\pop[2]I can rest easy, however, knowing that all my friends have opened up.
\pop[2]To anyone viewing my memories, I have no doubt. You \c[14]know\c[0] we're good people.
\pop[2]I can't even say we're good people caught up in a bad sitaution.
\pop[2]I've truly come to believe that we're doing the right thing.
\pop[2]We may not "destroy" \c[10]Argus\c[0], but they need a reality check.
\pop[2]They can't have as tight of a grip on the world as they do. It's immoral.
\pop[2]\c[23]Cipher\c[0] can rise up, and be the first threat to the monopoly of \c[10]Argus\c[0].
\pop[2]I look forward to a world full of progress and innovation. It sure beats what we have...
\pop[2]But for now, I take a large swig of soda, enjoying the company of my friends.
\pop[2]Friends. That's right. But now, we're also Agents of \c[23]Cipher\c[0], however unwittingly.
I'll finally get to show you the full extent of my skills.
\pop[3]Putting Kyron in \c[10]The System\c[0] wasn't the full extent of your skills?
\pop[4]Don't worry, Dante. You're on my good side.
Let's just make sure it stays that way.
\pop[3]Are you gonna tell us what the plan is, yet?
\pop[4]I have to wait until the time is right.
A lot of this is on a "need-to-know" basis.
\pop[4]I know, I've always wanted to say it.
\pop[2]Taylor looks worried. I can tell that the fear must be getting to him.
\pop[4]So what do we do in the meantime?
It's the last time we might get to do this.
It was kind of an... "abstract" statement.
\pop[3]He just means the status quo is gonna change.
\pop[4]Of course. I have this down to a science.
So how about we celebrate, instead of worrying?
We want to look back on this as a \c[14]happy\c[0] time.
\pop[4]I guess I wasn't the only one.
\pop[4]Oh. Well, in that case, me too.
\pop[4]It's always important to look back before looking forward.
Reminiscing is \c[14]always\c[0] important in the face of change.
\pop[3]Yeah. The past is always set in stone.
The safety of the past is the greatest treasure we can never possess.
\pop[3]I guess \c[10]Argus\c[0] is aiming to change that?
\pop[3]Just another way to keep us in line.
Super cheap booze, and a glorified \c[14]dream machine\c[0].
\pop[4]We're gonna put a dent in that plan, though.
Without their monopoly, their control will be limited.
\pop[4]\c[10]Argus\c[0] can't keep things like this forever, right?
If they have sole ownership, then they have sole control.
\pop[3]I mean, we \c[14]might\c[0] be able to take that control away from them.
But at the end of the day, \c[17]Komorebi\c[0] trumps everything.
\pop[3]We'll never be able to compete with a force like that.
Especially when we don't even understand it.
\pop[3]Doubtful. Especially when it's easier to just run and hide.
This \c[10]Nostalgia Technology\c[0] is basically admitting defeat.
\pop[4]But at the end of the day, it's still a new technology.
That's kind of exciting, with how stagnant things have been.
\pop[2]Right. We've all become creatures of routine.
\pop[2]I remember Isaac saying as much back when I first arrived.
Can't wait to see what happens when we open the floodgates.
\pop[4]A race with one person is pretty boring, right?
They have no reason to push themselves forward.
\pop[4]Throw a few more people into the mix? Things go \c[14]haywire\c[0].
If \c[23]Cipher\c[0] wins, then a \c[14]lot\c[0] more people will enter the fray.
\pop[4]As for what they'll create? I see \c[14]unlimited\c[0] potential.
Who knows? Maybe we'll even find a way to stop \c[17]Komorebi\c[0].
But if \c[17]Komorebi\c[0] benefits \c[10]Argus\c[0], of course they'd want to keep it around.
We won't really know what's possible until more people get a say.
\pop[3]When you put it like that, I'm kind of excited.
\pop[4]How do you stop visions of the future, though?
Aren't you stuck with them, even if you defy them?
\pop[2]I remember talking about that on the way to the nightclub.
\pop[2]If you defied your vision, you'd still experience it all the time.
\pop[2]In my mind, that changed the very nature of visions to begin with.
\i[3]"What if they aren't visions of the future...?"
\i[3]"What if they aren't visions of the future...?"
\pop[4]I'd have to ask you to elaborate.
\i[3]"Well, it's only the future from \c[14]your\c[0] perspective."
\i[3]"Well, it's only the future from \c[14]your\c[0] perspective."
\i[3]"To your future self, it'd be a vision of the past."
\i[3]"To your future self, it'd be a vision of the past."
\i[3]"You only call it the future because of the side you're on right now."
\i[3]"You only call it the future because of the side you're on right now."
\i[3]"You plan to defy your visions, and stay friends, right?"
\i[3]"You plan to defy your visions, and stay friends, right?"
\i[3]"Then it won't always be a vision of the future."
\i[3]"Then it won't always be a vision of the future."
\i[3]"Eventually, it'll become a vision of an alternate past."
\i[3]"Eventually, it'll become a vision of an alternate past."
\pop[3]Right now, we're trapped on one side of our visions.
The side where we see it as our future, and nothing else.
\pop[3]When I live past the point in my vision, it'll just be an echo.
Some... weird memory of a past that never was.
\pop[3]And for some reason, I think that's comforting.
I feel a bit more free when I think about it that way.
\pop[3]I guess that's the power of perspective.
"Alternate lives" is a pretty common theory, too.
Doesn't change how intrusive they are.
I hate mine, no matter "when" it comes from.
\pop[3]At least it might not come true.
It's better to stay a vision, than become reality.
\pop[4]This is starting to make my head hurt.
\pop[4]But if it means I might not be on a colony in the future?
Then I'll take it. \c[14]Any\c[0] bit of hope is better than what I have right now.
\pop[4]What if we \c[14]want\c[0] our vision to come true, though?
\pop[3]I guess that's when it becomes a double-edged sword.
Your comfort can just be someone else's worry.
\pop[3]Where does the alternate past come from, then?
It feels way too real to just be a "possibility".
\pop[2]That's the question that the end of this conversation lingers on.
\pop[2]Future, or past, the visions had to come from \c[14]somewhere\c[0].
\pop[2]That's an interesting thing to think about, though.
\pop[2]If Komorebi was the echo of another life...?
\pop[2]I had no echo to witness, after all...
\pop[2]Could \c[14]this\c[0] life just become the \c[17]Komorebi\c[0] of another me?
\pop[2]Maybe another version of me was witnessing this moment right now.
\pop[2]In a hotel room, with friends, about to infiltrate \c[10]Argus\c[0] HQ and oppose them.
\pop[2]If \c[14]that\c[0] was the vision I had as a kid? I'd probably do anything to oppose it.
\pop[2]After all, I would see no merit in going against the powers that basically govern our world.
\pop[2]So, in this exact moment, I finally feel happy and content with my lack of a vision.
\pop[2]I truly live my life for me. Not to avoid anything; and not to pursue it, either.
\pop[2]Because if I had a vision, I might not even be here right now.
\pop[2]But after everything I've experienced? I know \c[14]one\c[0] thing.
\pop[2]\c[14]This\c[0] is where I was meant to be.
\pop[2]And I got here with the ability to call all of my choices my own.
\pop[2]I didn't follow a vision. No invisible hand guided me down this path.
\pop[2]And hopefully, one day, this kind of life would be the norm...
